meanings.definition: (adjective) most awkward or difficult to handle due to small or intricate details
meanings.sent1: The fiddliest puzzle pieces were the tiny ones that kept slipping from my fingers.
meanings.sent2: She found the fiddliest task to be untangling the delicate necklace chain.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the fiddliest button on his shirt, he accidentally sewed it to his sleeve.
meanings.sent4: The fiddliest part of the model airplane was the minuscule propeller that required steady hands.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler's fiddliest work involved setting the tiny diamonds in the intricate bracelet.

meanings.definition: (adverb) in a manner that is the most awkward or difficult to handle due to small or intricate details
meanings.sent1: She sewed the buttons fiddliest, taking extra care with the delicate fabric.
meanings.sent2: He painted the model car fiddliest, ensuring every tiny detail was perfect.
meanings.sent3: The chef chopped the vegetables fiddliest, making sure each piece was uniform in size.
meanings.sent4: The artist sketched the intricate design fiddliest, capturing every small detail.
meanings.sent5: The watchmaker assembled the timepiece fiddliest, focusing on the tiny gears and springs.
